articles.title: Twice the Size and 50x the Power: Jupiter’s Primordial Past Revealed - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Jupiter wasn’t always the planet we know today—it was once twice as big, had a magnetic field 50 times stronger, and its early might shaped the very architecture of our solar system. Using the orbits of two tiny inner moons, scientists have reverse-engineered…
articles.content:
An illustration of Jupiter with magnetic field lines emitting from its poles. Credit: K. Batygin
